questionListItems.title: Will the OBS course involve only students from my child's school, or will there be students from other schools participating as well?

answer.body:
The MOE-OBS Challenge Programme is an inter-school course, which means that there will be students from multiple schools participating in the course.


Each group will have a maximum of 14 students, with a mix of students from 3 to 5 schools in a group.

questionListItems.title: Is the MOE-OBS Programme compulsory for my child?

answer.body: Parental consent is required for your child to participate in an OBS course. While it is voluntary, the experience is part of the school curriculum and an opportunity to interact with peers from within and outside of the school.

questionListItems.title: If my child cannot attend the OBS course, what will he do in school while his other friends are in OBS?

answer.body: The MOE-OBS Challenge Programme is part of the school curriculum. For those who cannot be enrolled to MOE-OBS Challenge Programme (with valid reasons), they will attend school as usual during the course week. Parents may reach out to the school to find out about the arrangement.

questionListItems.title: Will parents be updated on the child’s progress by MOE-OBS? Or it goes by “No news is good news.”

answer.body: The MOE-OBS Challenge Programme operates on an expeditionary model where 12-14 students will travel from one campsite to another, daily under the care and guidance of an OBS Instructor. Regular updates are not operationally feasible due to the involvement of multiple (4 to 6) schools each course. Rest assured, the safety of each student is an utmost priority for OBS.

questionListItems.title: Can my child use handphone at night?

answer.body: No, your child’s mobile phone will be safekept by OBS to ensure minimal distraction during the course, to disconnect from technology and to connect with their peers. If you need to reach your child for any emergency, you may contact the school’s teacher coordinator, who will contact the OBS Programme Manager assigned to the school.

questionListItems.title: If it rains during the course, what is the wet weather plan? Does my child need to pack poncho?

answer.body:
OBS activities are conducted in the outdoors and safety protocols are in place to monitor lightning risks. OBS will provide ponchos to students as part of their key equipment for the course and if necessary, groups will seek shelter at a suitable/nearby location.


Depending on weather condition, location of the group and available resources at that point, the OBS activities may be adjusted in wet weather conditions.

questionListItems.title: Where can I obtain the packing list for the course?

answer.body: Please refer to the packing list (www.go.gov.sg/5dmocpackinglist).

questionListItems.title: Will the school prepare the students for the course as part of the curriculum?

answer.body: Yes, the course is part of school curriculum where there are pre and post lessons facilitated by school teachers to prepare for the OBS course.

questionListItems.title: What can I do to ensure my child does not get sunburn?

answer.body: To prevent sunburn, parents can advise their child to apply sunscreen with a high SPF before going outdoors, and to reapply it regularly throughout the day. Students should also wear a hat or cap and sunglasses to protect their face and eyes from the sun. Additionally, students should wear lightweight, long-sleeved clothing to cover their skin and avoid direct exposure to the sun during peak hours. It is also important for students to stay hydrated by drinking plenty of water throughout the day.

questionListItems.title: For students requiring vegetarian diet, what will be the arrangement.

answer.body:
Students with a vegetarian diet will be provided a vegetarian ration. During the outdoor cooking, the instructor will provide guidance on the type of food that the student can cook and consume.

Ensure the dietary requirement is clearly indicated during the course registration process.

questionListItems.title: Will each school have teachers attending as Guardians for the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme?

answer.body: The teachers are not required to attend the course with the students.

questionListItems.title: How can I find out more on the MOE-OBS Challenge Programme?

answer.body: You may visit our website at https://www.nyc.gov.sg/moc/ for more information.

questionListItems.title: If my child is participating in water activities, am I required to buy shoes designed for water activities e.g. water booties?

answer.body:
It is not necessary to buy a new pair of water activities shoes. OBS encourages students to use existing shoes or to borrow instead. Any secured shoes that cover the feet including heels and toes for protection against rocks and hard objects below the water surface is sufficient for participation in water activities during the OBS course.


Do note that rubber clogs and sandals are not allowed to be worn for water activities.

questionListItems.title: Is there a need to submit certificates like Swim safer, etc if my child is participating in water activities?

answer.body: There is no need to submit any certificate for activity participation. As part of the water activity preparation, it is mandatory for all students to put on the personal floatation device regardless of their swimming ability. Instructors will conduct a water confidence session to allow students to be more comfortable and confident in the water and may put in additional measures to help non-swimmers e.g. assigning a confident swimmer as buddy.

questionListItems.title: If my child does not want to participate in the activity because he/she is afraid, will he/she be allowed to sit out from the activity?

answer.body: Your child will not be forced to participate if they are not ready. Instructors will form an encouraging and supportive environment with the group to help your child expand their comfort zone if they wish to attempt the activity. If you child has concerns, they can speak with their instructors.
